meanings.definition: The ability to speak two languages fluently.
meanings.sent1: Her bilinguality in English and Spanish helped her communicate with people from different countries.
meanings.sent2: Growing up in a multicultural environment, his bilinguality was a valuable asset.
meanings.sent3: The parrot's bilinguality in mimicking sounds made it the star of the pet show.
meanings.sent4: His bilinguality in coding languages made him a sought-after software developer.
meanings.sent5: The bilinguality of the tour guide made the trip more enjoyable and informative.

meanings.sent1: The school celebrated the students' bilinguality with a special event.
meanings.sent2: Growing up in a diverse neighborhood, she embraced her bilinguality with pride.
meanings.sent3: The comedy skit humorously portrayed the challenges of bilinguality in a fun way.
meanings.sent4: In the world of diplomacy, bilinguality is often seen as a diplomatic advantage.
meanings.sent5: The bilinguality of the twins amazed their friends and family.
